page.title: 01Brockenhurst
page.content: Brockenhurst is a popular village with a ford in the main street. It is found on the winding route from either Lymington or Beaulieu. The name Brockenhurst is known to mean{Badgers {Wood}There is a Norman Church, built on a mound and the yew tree in the church yard is believed to have survived for a thousand years. The churchyard is famous for many memorials including that of Brusher Mills, who brushed the New Forest cricket ground between innings. He also caught snakes and during his life worked as a snake catcher.
